intro: Auerodendron cubense var. morroensis, commonly known as the Morro hill hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and limestone hills. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
